item.title: Kaanak ng OFW na nasawi sa pagsabog sa Beirut, umapela sa gobyerno; mga nasaktan, umakyat sa 24
item.description: Nanawagan ang mga kaanak ng OFW na nasawi sa pagsabog sa Beirut, Lebanon na tulungan silang maiuwi sa bansa ang mga labi nito. Samantala, nakita na ang huling Pinoy seafarer na nawawala dahil sa naturang trahediya at umakyat sa 24 ang bilang ng mga Pinoy doon na nasaktan.

item.title: Philippines conducted more tests than 6 other Asian nations in July -- NTF
item.description: The Philippines conducted more the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) tests daily for for the month of July than six other Asian nations, National Task Force Against COVID-19 (NTF) deputy implementer and testing czar Vince Dizon said Wednesday.

item.title: Some teachers fear getting COVID-19 from students' school work
item.description: " Pag balik po ng module na manggagaling sa bata, walong subject sa isang box ang magkakagulo para kumuha noog activity na nanggaling sa bata,” the teacher said.“Ano po ang kasiguraduhan na lahat po noong materyales na yon ay hindi po naapektuhan noong virus na yon?” she added.

item.title: Videos show explosion in North Korean town - reports
item.description: Videos shot from China show an explosion lighting up the night sky across the border in North Korea, multiple media reported on Wednesday, in what one South Korean outlet said was an apparent gas leak that caused a deadly blast on Monday.

item.title: 10 sa 11 Pinoy seafarer na nawawala matapos ang pagsabog sa Beirut, nakitang ligtas--DFA
item.description: Natagpuang ligtas bagaman nagtamo ng bahagyang mga sugat ang 10 sa 11 Pinoy seafarers na unang iniulat na nawawala matapos ang malakas na pagsabog na naganap sa Beirut, Lebanon, ayon sa Department of Foreign Affairs.

item.title: Moderna priced COVID-19 vaccine at $32-$37 per dose for smaller volume deals -CEO
item.description: Moderna Inc said on Wednesday smaller volume agreements for its experimental coronavirus vaccine candidate have been executed between $32 and $37 per dose (or around P1,500 and P1,800 ).

item.title: Manila trike drivers struggle to earn income amid MECQ
item.description: Tricycle drivers in Manila on Wednesday lamented that income is hard to come by under the modified enhanced community quarantine due lack of passengers.

item.title: SJDM folk told: Stay at home or stay near jobs during lockdown
item.description: “Hindi po sila puwedeng umuwi ng San Jose kundi sila po y dapat manirahan kung saan sila nagtratrabaho sa Metro Manila," San Jose Del Monte Mayor Arthur Robes."Bahala na po yung employer nila. Kung ayaw nila magtrabaho, mamimili lang po sila, mag-stay sila dito sa amin sa San Jose,” he added.

item.title: Go, Hontiveros want special bodies to look into PhilHealth irregularities
item.description: "We cannot simply rely on its leadership to cleanse its ranks. We need a whole-of-government approach through a Task Force that has enough teeth to investigate, audit, prosecute, file charges and put in jail those responsible for these anomalies," Senatr Bong Go said.

item.title: Do you really need to party? WHO asks world s youth
item.description: Young people must curb their party instincts to help prevent new outbreaks of the COVID-19 disease, officials at the World Health Organization (WHO) pleaded on Wednesday.

item.title: House OKs proposed Bayanihan 2 on 2nd reading
item.description: The House of Representatives on Wednesday approved on second reading the proposed Bayanihan to Recover As One Act, outlining P162 billion worth of response interventions to help the country recover from the COVID-19 crisis and boost the economy.

item.title: Parañaque gov t distributes P5k to families that have not received aid since March
item.description: The city government of Parañaque has begun distributing P5,000 in financial aid to some 50,000 households that have not received any form of assistance from the national government since a community quarantine was imposed in March.

item.title: PNP records 33 new COVID-19 cases; total now at 2,437
item.description: The Philippine National Police (PNP) on Wednesday recorded 33 new cases of the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) among its personnel, raising the total number to 2,347.

item.title: Angara, dismayado sa umano'y katiwalian sa PhilHealth: 'Wala bang konsensiya ang mga taong ito?'
item.description: Matapos ang halos 10 oras na pagdinig na ginawa ng Senado tungkol sa umano'y katiwalian sa Philippine Health Insurance Corporation (PhilHealth) nitong Martes, naniniwala ang ilang senador na kailangang magpatupad ang Malacañang ng matinding reporma sa ahensiya para matigil na ang umano'y kalokohan at katiwalian dito.

item.title: Initial investigations point to negligence as cause of Beirut blast -source
item.description: BEIRUT - Initial investigations indicate years of inaction and negligence over the storage of highly explosive material in Beirut port caused the blast that killed over 100 people on Tuesday, an official source familiar with the findings said.
